purpleculture_pinyin:
shú
to redeem; to ransom
выкупать; выкуп
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 赎)
Antonyms: 押
Ideographic: To sell 賣 a soul for money 貝; 賣 also provides the pronunciation
purpleculture_examples:
贖罪 [ shú zuì ]: to atone for one's crime; to buy freedom from punishment; redemption; atonement
贖金 [ shú jīn ]: ransom
贖回 [ shú huí ]: to redeem
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 貝 [ bèi ] sea shell; money, currency
    • 賣 [ mài ] to sell; to betray; to show off
heisig_chinese_memo: The "Shell Sell" is a big sale where you can redeem coupons for oysters.
Kanshudo_mnemonic: you sell (賣) the shellfish (貝) to make up for (your loss)
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: The shellfish lost his job but redeems himself by selling seafood at the local city market.  He knows all the best sources in the ocean.
humanum_full_description_en:
The word " redemption " is derived from " bei ". In ancient times, " bei " was used as currency. From " bei ", it means transaction and sale. "Said Wen": "Redemption, trade. Cong Bei, 𧷏 sound."

Jin Wen expresses the transaction, Jian Ding: "I am the (redemption) female (ru) five husbands, and I use the horse to tie the silk as my father."

" Redemption " means exchange and substitution in ancient books, "Poetry. Qin Feng. "Yellow Bird": "If it can be redeemed, people have a hundred lives." Zheng Xuanjian: "Such a dying death can be redeemed by others, everyone has a hundred lives." It means that if it can be replaced, we would rather use one. The lives of a hundred people, in exchange for his own life (Ma Chiying).

" Redemption " later often means that the price is exchanged for the collateral or person, namely redemption. Southern Dynasties Liang Renfang "Playing with Liu Zheng": "Yin used his personal money to redeem him as an uncle, but he still sent to Guangzhou." Qing Jiyun, "Yuewei Cottage Notes. Luanyang Xiaoxia Record III: "Because the old Hufang Bridge house has not been redeemed, I have the right to live in the empty house of Mr. Qian Xiangshu."
humanum_short_description_en: " Redemption " comes from the sound of " Bei " and " 𧷏 ". The original meaning is sale and transaction.
humanum_full_description:
「贖」字從「貝」，上古以「貝」為貨幣，從「貝」有交易、買賣之意。《說文》：「贖，貿也。从貝，𧷏聲。」

　　金文表示交易，曶鼎：「我即𧷏(贖)女(汝)五夫，效父用匹馬束絲」。

　　「贖」在古書中表示交換、代替，《詩．秦風．黃鳥》：「如可贖兮，人百其身。」鄭玄箋：「如此奄息之死，可以他人贖之者，人皆百其身。」意謂如果可以代替的話，我們寧願以一百人的生命，去換取他一個人的生命（馬持盈）。

　　「贖」後來多表示用代價換回抵押品或人，即贖回。南朝梁任昉〈奏彈劉整〉：「寅以私錢七千贖當伯，仍使上廣州去。」清紀昀《閱微草堂筆記．灤陽消夏錄三》：「因虎坊橋舊宅未贖，權住錢香樹先生空宅中。」
_purpleculture_dictionary_orig_full:
贖 (Simplified: 赎)
Pinyin: shú
English Definition: to redeem; to ransom
Antonyms: 押
Total strokes: 22; Radical: 貝
Ideographic: To sell 賣 a soul for money 貝; 賣 also provides the pronunciation
Character Formation:
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 貝 [ bèi ] sea shell; money, currency
    • 賣 [ mài ] to sell; to betray; to show off
Example Words:
贖罪 [ shú zuì ]: to atone for one's crime; to buy freedom from punishment; redemption; atonement
贖金 [ shú jīn ]: ransom
贖回 [ shú huí ]: to redeem
More: 贖* | *贖 | *贖*

Main pronunciation 主要发音: shú

Other pronunciations 其它发音: Not exists.

Original meaning 本义: Meaning to buy. (卖賣 mài also means to buy)

English senses 英语理解: buy, redeem; ransome; atone for

Usage example 用法举例: 救贖 jiù shú (salvation)

Importance by frequency 常用频率: 2603

Shuowen 说文解字: 貿也從貝賣聲

Compound 贖 from cowry (贝)貝 bèi and phonetic sell-variant (卖)賣𧶠𧸇 yù (not- 卖賣𧷵 mài) simp 赎.

「 贖 」字從「 貝 」，上古以「 貝 」為貨幣，從「 貝 」有交易、買賣之意。《說文》：「贖，貿也。从貝，𧷏聲。」 金文表示交易，曶鼎：「我即𧷏(贖)女(汝)五夫，效父用匹馬束絲」。 「 贖 」在古書中表示交換、代替，《詩．秦風．黃鳥》：「如可贖兮，人百其身。」鄭玄箋：「如此奄息之死，可以他人贖之者，人皆百其身。」意謂如果可以代替的話，我們寧願以一百人的生命，去換取他一個人的生命（馬持盈）。 「 贖 」後來多表示用代價換回抵押品或人，即贖回。南朝梁任昉〈奏彈劉整〉：「寅以私錢七千贖當伯，仍使上廣州去。」清紀昀《閱微草堂筆記．灤陽消夏錄三》：「因虎坊橋舊宅未贖，權住錢香樹先生空宅中。」
The word " redemption" is derived from " bei". In ancient times, " bei" was used as currency. From " bei", it means transaction and sale. "Said Wen": "Redemption, trade. Cong Bei, 𧷏 sound." Jin Wen expresses the transaction, Jian Ding: "I am the (redemption) female (ru) five husbands, and I use the horse to tie the silk as my father." " Redemption" means exchange and substitution in ancient books, "Poetry. Qin Feng. "Yellow Bird": "If it can be redeemed, people have a hundred lives." Zheng Xuanjian: "Such a dying death can be redeemed by others, everyone has a hundred lives." It means that if it can be replaced, we would rather use one. The lives of a hundred people, in exchange for his own life (Ma Chiying). " Redemption" later often means that the price is exchanged for the collateral or person, namely redemption. Southern Dynasties Liang Renfang "Playing with Liu Zheng": "Yin used his personal money to redeem him as an uncle, but he still sent to Guangzhou." Qing Jiyun, "Yuewei Cottage Notes. Luanyang Xiaoxia Record III: "Because the old Hufang Bridge house has not been redeemed, I have the right to live in the empty house of Mr. Qian Xiangshu."

贖字的基本解释

贖
shú
见“赎”。

贖字的汉语字典释义

[①]［shú］
［《廣韻》神蜀切，入燭，船。］
“赎1”的繁体字。
(1)用钱物或其他代价换回人身或抵押品。
(2)买。
(3)谓抵销或弥补过失。
(4)通“續”。接合。

贖字的康熙字典解释

【酉集中】【貝字部】　贖； 康熙笔画：22； 页码：页1213第08
【廣韻】【集韻】【韻會】?神蜀切，音䴰。【說文】貿也。【玉篇】質也。以財拔罪也。【書·舜典】金作贖?。【傳】出金以贖罪。　又【集韻】殊遇切，音樹。【詩·秦風】如可贖兮。【釋文】贖，又音樹。　又【集韻】亦姓。

贖字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
贖字的起名意思

暂无。

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［shú］
["Guang Yun" Shen Shu cut, enter the candle, ship. ]
Traditional Chinese characters for "買1".
(1) Exchange for personal or collateral with money, material or other considerations.
(2) Buy.
(3) Said to offset or make up for negligence.
(4) Through "continued". Splice.
redemption

[Explanation] Redemption, and sound tree.　[Jiyun] Also last name.
